extendedInfo.description: Take control of your finances today with PocketMoney. A powerful yet easy to use personal finance manager, PocketMoney lets you track your cash flow, understand your net worth, and improve the overall health of your finances on your iPhone, iPod Touch, or iPad, and now your Android device. Syncing to PocketMoney for Desktops (and to PocketMoney for iOS) will be part of version 1.1!The system is simple, and a minute a day using PocketMoney will help you navigate through the pitfalls of the current economy. âº Start by entering all your income and expenses as they happen across multiple accounts such as credit cards, savings, and checking accounts. PocketMoney can track thousands of transactions through many years of financial data with no performance loss. Transactions can be split across multiple categories, transferred across accounts and can also be scheduled to occur at regular intervals. âº Analyze your overall financial health by using the built-in reporting features of PocketMoney. âº If you use Quicken or MS Money, then you can export your desktop data to PocketMoney, enter data on the road, then export changes back to your desktop app via QIF files. (Quicken Essentials doesn't support QIF exports/imports.) Features Include: Accounts â Lite version limited to 2 accounts (full version is unlimited) â Accounts include credit cards, checking, overdraft, savings and more â Proven performance and responsiveness â Repeating transactions with complex logic (limited to 2 accounts - full version is unlimited)â Splits and Transfers â Reconcile and rollup your accounts. â Current, future, cleared balance displays â Customized account ordering, grouping and graphics â Customized transaction entry preferences â Custom filters Reports â Custom reporting for Accounts, Categories, Class and Payee Interoperability â Email Partner feature to share transaction with your partner (works between iOS and Android versions, too)â Email and SD card backup/restore â Import - TDF, CSV, QIFâ Export - TDF, CSV, QIF Usability â Multi-currency â Password protection â Transaction searchUpgrade to Full version to...â¢ Remove adsâ¢ Unlimited number of accountsâ¢ Unlimited number of repeating transactionsâ¢ Custom filterskeywords: budget currencies qfx checkbook ms quicken qif savings checks expenses pocket personal money cash ofx banking bank finance finances credit cards checking

reviews.title: QIF export is broken
reviews.comment: If I try to export from an individual account to QIF via sd card or email the app hangs. If I back out to the accounts menu and export all accounts to QIF it works fine. Running Android 4.2.2 on galaxy S4
reviews.author: Jeff Jepsen

reviews.title: Not getting imported date correct
reviews.comment: I have set the date to import thus: dd/mm/yyyy This is correct, it\'s how moth MS Money, and open office calc show it.  It\'s how i want to show it!  I\'ve tried loads of different options, obviously started with: QIF options/Date Format/ dd/mm/yyyy,   but it still doesn\'t work, it shows as mm/dd/yyyy  It\'s driving me bloody nuts, and is the only thing that is stopping me buying both this and the desktop app!  Please help.  PS: i would have emailed the developers but i\'m in a rush, if  i get no joy here i\'ll do it when i get back from my holidays.
reviews.author: Sharon Heritage

reviews.title: Works great except for SD card transfer limitation
reviews.comment: Limitation of exporting to QIF using SD card transfer if the transactions in one account is greater than 9 to 10 transactions.  The application hangs and need to force close. Please fix this problem.  Thanks.
reviews.author: Arnold Ablaza

reviews.title: HK User
reviews.comment: Cannot sync Budgets with Pocket Money for Desktop (this function in iOS version also works), and can you add some high-res icons. Please fix.
reviews.author: CKL .

reviews.title: Does
reviews.comment: After importing my bank statements in M$ Money\'s format, I am happy. Reservation of fifth star after a few months of useage.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: I\'ll wait
reviews.comment: Long, long ago, like 8-10 years, I used PocketMoney on a Palm, and liked it. Now I\'ve installed the Lite version, and found out, that I have less functionality, than in those ancient times. Specifically I miss  reconcile, and transaction split is somehow more complicated, than what I remember from the old times... The program is still useful, but I\'m holding the purchase decision until at least I get the Palm functionality.
reviews.author: Jerzy Micha\305\202 Pawlak

reviews.title: Works fine for what I need
reviews.comment: I have no problems with this app. I only use it to manage one account (my daily use account). I also use the desktop version on my Linux laptop and have had no sync issues. Also never had any problems with the apps operation, either.
reviews.author: Ron Gregory

reviews.title: hangs every second run.
reviews.comment: On GS2 with ICS, program is greyed out every second time its run. i had to close via task manager. Uninstalled.
reviews.author: Jamie Sadler

reviews.comment: Very very buggy. Do not trust this software!!! Sync problems and the desktop version does not calculate correctly either. Avoid!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Love this app!
reviews.comment: Everything works great. I just wish I could place the Payee above the Category on new entries.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great! *tony the tiger voice*
reviews.comment: Amazing app. Can\'t say enough about it. Keeps more mony in my pocket
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Fix all the bugs. Not near as good as app on iPhone. Glad I didn\'t buy it.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Not user friendly interface for me.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Free version works. Paid version FCs when adding third recurring payment :-(
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: I used the ios version and really liked it much better. was a bit disappointed with this one in comparison.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Trial app doesn\'t work
reviews.comment: Trial app hangs on loading.  I installed and uninstalled and tried it again. No change.
reviews.author: Jim Parfitt

reviews.title: Can\'t open
reviews.comment: ICS on galaxy s2, can\'t even open it, all greyed out. Used this on my iPod Touch for years. Disappointed.
reviews.author: Shugg McGlummfer
